results.title: Politics, power and the public good
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
A long-term popular politician, proud of “getting things done for the people”, ruthlessly fights to retain his office with a panoply of unethical tactics and henchmen. Deeply entrenched in corruption, the politician retains his office due to the efforts of his supporters who organised a mass movement of popular support for him. Edited from the film “All the King’s Men” produced and directed by Robert Rossen.

results.title: My country: right or wrong? [Extract from 'Summertree']
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
An extract from the feature film “Summertree” produced by Kirk Douglas and directed by Anthony Newley. Raises issues concerning the individual, patriotism and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Love to kill
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Specially edited from “Bless the beasts and children”. Raises issues surrounding the right to kill, the right to carry and use firearms, and the morality of taking the law into your own hands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: I who am, who am I?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Uses extracts from the film “The Swimmer” (1968) to explore the theme of the individual’s struggle for self-awareness and identity. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Fine art of aggression
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Ronald Shedlo and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Presents a story of one man’s ruthless determination to succeed in business at the expense of his co-workers. Shows how destruction of self and others results when an unthwarted will goes beyond the norms of reason. Edited from the Columbia Pictures 1969 motion picture entitled “The Reckoning”.

results.title: The Dehumanizing city...and Hymie Schultz
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, George Justin, Colombia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Adapted from the film “The Tiger makes out” with Eli Wallach, the theme here is the modern individual in conflict with complex bureaucratic systems. Waking up one morning to the callous impersonality of big city life, Hymie Schultz, mailman, decides to fight back. Bureaucracy, however, proves more stubborn than he, and at the end of the day defeated and helpless, he retreats, one individual lost among many.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Hiller, George Justin, Colombia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America

group_works.title: Magnus and the beansteak
group_works.creator_credit: Harris Watts, John Fairley and Yorkshire Television

results.title: Magnus and the beansteak
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, John Fairley and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scientists”.
The views of food technologist, Magnus Pyke on the production of synthetic foods derived from soya beans and chemicals, that could prevent heart disease and help to feed some of the world’s undernourished population.

results.title: What would happen if...? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
First grade children sort materials, and compare wood with sawdust. Second grade children experiment with objects and are introduced to the terms interaction, sub-systems and variables. Third graders find which part of a mixture changes the colour of a BTB/vinegar solution, and experiment with changing variables.
